intro: Clidemia biolleyana, commonly known as the silverleaf false mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Clidemia biolleyana is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy blooms and cotton-like seeds.
